Package danogl.gui

Class ImageReader

java.lang.Object
danogl.gui.ImageReader
public class ImageReader extends Object
Used to read images from disk or from within a jar
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageReader

      public ImageReader(MessageHandler messages)

  • Method Details

    • readImage

      public ImageRenderable readImage(String path, boolean isTopLeftPixelTransparency, Vector2 cropTopLeft, Vector2 cropBottomRight)
      Read an image from disk or internally from the jar. The image may contain an alpha channel. If it doesn't, background color may still be removed using the second parameter. The image may also be cropped. If the call fails, an error message will be displayed and the window will be closed.
      Parameters:
      path - Relative or absolute path
      isTopLeftPixelTransparency - If true, it is assumed the top-left corner is part of the background. All pixels with this color will be invisible.
      cropTopLeft - pixel coordinates of top-left rectangle to crop from the image. The pixel at these coordinates is included. If cropping is not desired, set to Vector2.ZERO.
      cropBottomRight - pixel coordinates of bottom-right rectangle to crop from the image. The pixel at these coordinates is excluded. If cropping is not desired, set to Vector2.ZERO.
      Returns:
      An ImageRenderable of the desired image, null if failed to load the image

    • readImage

      public ImageRenderable readImage(String path, boolean isTopLeftPixelTransparency)
      Read an image from disk or internally from the jar. The image may contain an alpha channel. If it doesn't, background color may still be removed using the second parameter. If the call fails, an error message will be displayed and the window will be closed.
      Parameters:
      path - Relative or absolute path
      isTopLeftPixelTransparency - If true, it is assumed the top-left corner is part of the background. All pixels with this color will be invisible.
      Returns:
      An ImageRenderable of the desired image, null if failed to load the image

    • clearCache

      public void clearCache()
      Images are cached together with their crop settings. This method clears the current cache of loaded images. Can be useful in one of the following scenarios:
      1) Many images have been loaded and are using excessive memory, without being used anymore.
      2) The file has changed on-disk since it was last loaded.
      Note that caching is specific to an ImageReader instance. If you wish to bypass caching altogether, one way of doing so would be creating additional ImageReader instances (each would have its own separate cache).

    • messageHandler

      public MessageHandler messageHandler()
      Returns the window's WindowController
